borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p style="">The proposed development, by reason of its bulk, mass, scale and&nbsp;&nbsp;siting of the would result in a significant loss of privacy and outlook resulting in an overbearing impact especially for no.8 <span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="Standfield" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lpmonrj02gq1ucx0n" style="">Standfield</span> Road, therefore constituting unneighbourly development, therefore constituting unneighbourly development and contrary to:</p><ul><li style="">Paragraph 130(f) of the National Planning Policy Framework &nbsp;(<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="NPPF" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lpmonrm8ilgapugm9">NPPF</span>) (<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="DLUHC" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lpmonrm8sxqi7ds58">DLUHC</span>, September 2023) </li><li style="">Policy D6&nbsp;of the London Plan (March 2021); </li><li style="">Policy CP3 of Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010) </li><li style="">Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011) </li><li style="">Paragraph 4.2 of the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012); </li><li style="">Policies DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan 2037: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</li></ul>

<p style="">&nbsp;The proposed development, by reasons of its bulk, mass, scale, siting and design, would be an undesirable addition to the dwelling, disproportionate to the modest-scaled&nbsp;<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="dwellinghouse" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lpmonqv5l2hn48z0q" style="">dwellinghouse</span>&nbsp;and would close off the openness of the corner plot of the banjo cul-de-sac and thus is considered to have a detrimental impact on the&nbsp;<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="dwellinghouse" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lpmonqv5rnyy93u1d" style="">dwellinghouse</span>, built form of the terrace row and notably the wider area as the site is located within the&nbsp;<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="Becontree" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lpmonqv4dgpbgkrx7" style="">Becontree</span>&nbsp;Estate.&nbsp;&nbsp;As such, the proposed development is contrary to:<br></p><ul><li>Paragraphs 126, 130, 134, and 203 of the National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;&nbsp;(<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="NPPF" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lpmonrfo99jab1ml0">NPPF</span>) (<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="DLUHC" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lpmonrfnzq1tlpjbq">DLUHC</span>, September 2023)</li><li>Policies D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021)</li><li>Policies CP2 and CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)</li><li>Policies BP2, BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</li><li>Paragraph 5.4.5 of the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</li><li>Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan 2037: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</li></ul>
description: Construction of a double storey side extension and front porch.
